intro: Caesia chlorantha var. comosa, commonly known as the hairy caesia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive, finely divided structure. The flowers are small, white or pale green, and bloom in late spring to early summer.
